conclusion: Consider how shadows change when the light source moves.
A: Shadow of the cake, positioned below the cake.
B: Shadow of the spoon, positioned to the left of the spoon.
C: Shadow of the medical roll, positioned below the roll.
D: Shadow of the ring, positioned to the right of the ring.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows will shift towards the opposite direction (front left).
Shadows A and C (cake and medical roll) will move towards the front left.
Shadows B and D (spoon and ring) will move towards the front left but may shift slightly due to the angle change.
Shadows may appear slightly longer as the light source moves further back, depending on the angle.
The shadows in the second image appear to be shifted towards the front left.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will move towards the front left when the light source moves to the back right. The size of the shadows may increase slightly.
